title: Ticket #4566: Condor_rm of DAGMan doesn't work right on Windows
description:
BillT just found this as a result of trying to fix a DAGMan test that fails on Windows...

Anyhow, if you condor_rm DAGMan on Windows, the DAGMan process just gets killed, so you don't get a rescue DAG, you don't kill node jobs, etc.

TJ says that on Windows we send a WM_CLOSE message to a daemoncore process before killing it -- if it responds to that, we don't hard kill it right away. So the solution may be for DAGMan to become a GUI app on Windows (see the keyboardd for an example of this).
